FuncDef: The display ipv6 neighbors command displays information about ND entries. The display ipv6 neighbors command displays information about ND entries. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the IPv6 address. If this parameter is specified, information about ND entries of the specified IPv6 address is displayed.
The value is a 32-digit hexadecimal number, in the format X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

Specifies the name of an IPv6 VPN instance. If this parameter is specified, information about ND entries of the specified IPv6 VPN instance is displayed.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. In addition, the VPN instance name cannot be _public_. If the string is enclosed in double quotation marks (" "), the string can contain spaces..

Displays neighbor entries on a specified interface.
-

Displays neighbor entries on a specified interface.
-

Specifies brief information about neighbor entries.
-

Specifies a VLAN ID.
An integer ranging from 1 to 4094.

Specifies the slot ID. If this parameter is specified, information about neighbor entries on the specified slot ID is displayed.
The value is an integer. You can enter the question mark (?) and select the value as prompted.

ExtraInfo: Through the output of the display ipv6 neighbors command displays information about dynamic and static ND entries and check the following:
